page.title: 05Fyfield community
page.content: An old world village through which the main road used to run.Many of the inhabitants are elderly and have lived there all their lives.The only changes in the last 35 years have been the building of the bypass in 1972,the closing of the village school in 1981 and since 1983 the building of 7 new houses,4 of which are on the site of the old coal yard.The garage used to be the old blacksmith's shop and Mr.Smith remembers when he came 20 years ago some villagers still used methylated spirit lamps and cooked on paraffin stoves.Bunkers are visible in the field where villagers got water from a standpipe on the site of the windmill. The old people's club and an annual fete are the only organised recreation. The only sign of life on many visits were at the shop and on the charityland allotments.
